data: Provider to consider umbilical line placement for possible exchange transfusion
Notify Transfusion Medicine for possible exchange transfusion
Assign Bilirubin Induced Neurologic Dysfunction score on admission, and every 4 hours until bilirubin level less than exchange level
10 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: bag
Parental consent required for transfusion of Blood or Blood Products

Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
Blood, STAT, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - One Time
If/when after 3 hours of Level 4 phototherapy, then nurse to place order for bilirubin

The ideal time for the Newborn Screen is between 24 and 48 hours after birth. This applies to both term and premature infants. Repeat at 21 days of age if less than 1500 g or transfused prior to collection
Blood Spot, STAT, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Phototherapy: Level 4: Double Body Surface, Blanket, Irradiance of 30 to 65 microwatts/cm2/nm for blanket, Overhead, Irradiance of 50 to 70 microwatts/cm2/nm for overhead
Nurse to initiate this phase of the PowerPlan if Blood or Blood Products Administration is required
If Direct Antiglobulin Test results are positive, consider IVIG
If Direct Antiglobulin Test results are negative and albumin less than 30 g/L, consider 25% albumin 4 mL/kg
Nurse to initiate this phase of the PowerPlan if Exchange Transfusion is required
200 mg/kg, IV, q10min, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj

STAT, mL, IV, Administer over: Exchange Protocol, Dosing: Not Applicable, Whole Blood Exchange, Irradiated, Double volume exchange: 170 mL x weight (kg) +50 mL tubing. Length of exchange: 60 to 90 minutes

Physician will withdraw the first 5-20 mL aliquot via the UAC slowly from the infant and discard the blood into the waste bag   - 5 mL aliquot for infants less than 1500 grams  - 10 mL aliquot for infants 1500 to 2500 grams  - 15 mL aliquot for infants 2500 to 3000 grams  - 20 mL aliquot for infants greater than 3000 grams  Refer to Exchange Transfusion - Double Umbilical Line Procedure
Refer to Exchange Transfusion - Single Umbilical Venous Catheter Procedure
Nurse to initiate this phase of the PowerPlan after Exchange Transfusion is finished
Do not draw post-exchange labs until exchange transfusion is finished
